Class City

  • java.lang.Object
    • City

  • public class City
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing the city and the buildings within the city itself. Checks to change revenue from each of the buildings based on their location.
    Version:
    5/22/18
    Author:
    arleenliu

    • Method Detail

      • addBuilding

        public boolean addBuilding(Building b,
                           int xGrid,
                           int yGrid)
        Adds a building to the grid in the specified x, y location
        Parameters:
        b - Building to add to the city
        xGrid - x-location in the grid to place city
        yGrid - y-location in the grid to place city
        Returns:
        whether the building was successfully placed
        Postcondition:
        may add a building to the city

      • changeRevenue

        public void changeRevenue(int amount)
        Changes the current total amount of money
        Parameters:
        amount - amount to change the total amount of money by

      • calcRevenue

        public void calcRevenue()
        Updates the rate of revenue increase for the city based on buildings and their locations
        Postcondition:
        may change the amount of revenue a building makes based on its surroundings
